result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne B Triggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

03:21 PM Defendant Wayne B Triggs in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Cassie Miller, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne B Triggs appeared by video means.  The court addresses the defendant's request to be eligible for earned release program and challenge incarceration program.  Mr. Triggs informs the court he has been revoked.  The court finds the defendant, per statute is not eligible for the challenge incarceration program.  The court finds the defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program.  The court to amend the judgment of conviction accordingly.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Review hearing on August 7, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Wayne B Triggs in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Victim, Charles J. makes statements. Atty. Weathers makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3.5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 6 days) STAYED
-	1.5 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:

-No contact with Shasta L, Charles J, or Karla W.

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

-Agent to overview or manage any financial transactions, sign any/all releases needed

-Agent may monitor/restrict the defendant's internet access

Condition Time: 60 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS, elder care is allowed consistant to the rules of Huber - To commence 5/12/17 at 5:00 p.m.

Restitution: $15,200.00 to be paid to Shasta L. as a condition of probation
Restitution: $22,200.00 to be paid to Charles J. as a condition of probation

COSTS:  WAIVED

DNA Surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
